definitions.definition: a person who operates the controls of an aircraft, especially as a job

examples.text: The accident was caused by pilot error.
The pilot bailed out as the aircraft crashed into the ocean.
He has his own plane and a pilot's licence.

definitions.definition: a person with special knowledge of a difficult area of water, for example, the entrance to a harbour, whose job is to guide ships through it
a single television programme that is made in order to find out whether people will like it and want to watch further programmes
a small flame that burns all the time, for example on a gas boiler, and lights a larger flame when the gas is turned on

wordOrigin: early 16th cent. (denoting a person who steers a ship): from French pilote, from medieval Latin pilotus, an alteration of pedota, based on Greek pēdon ‘oar’, (plural) ‘rudder’.
